description: Mid 18th century borrowing from French glandulaire, from glandule (“small gland”) +‎ -aire (“-ar, -ary”, adjectival suffix), from Latin glandulae (“glands of the throat”); equivalent to glandule +‎ -ar.

definitionGroups.group: (medicine) Pertaining to a gland or glands.

entries.meaning: Having the characteristics or function of a gland.
A food supplement made from glands.
examples: Then Mr. Rothschild states that there is a wealth of studies attesting to the beneficence of glandulars in the human diet, only to fall into the same error he lays on Dr. Holub: failing to cite a single one.
